node.title: As WA prepares for living with COVID, will McGowan's roadmap ensure a soft landing?
node.description: With the state government's COVID roadmap finally unveiled, the days of 'Fortress WA' are numbered. But how smoothly the plan will unfold from here depends on a number of factors.
node.content:
["Fortress WA. The hermit kingdom. The golden cage.\u00a0", "Whatever you want to call it, the days are now numbered.", "But by how many, exactly?\u00a0", "That was the key question being asked after the WA government released its long-awaited transition plan\u00a0on Friday\u00a0for reuniting Western Australia with the rest of the world.", "For 18 months, the WA government has used the state's geography as its greatest defence against COVID-19.", "And it has\u00a0worked.\u00a0", "", "
WA has enjoyed relatively few restrictions compared to other states.(ABC News: Andrew O'Connor)
", "There have been just 1,112 COVID-19 cases in WA since the pandemic began, with\u00a0a total of nine deaths.", "At the same time, the WA economy has not only survived, but thrived.", "But after weeks of mounting pressure and a clear shift in community sentiment as international arrivals started to touch down in Sydney, WA\u00a0Premier Mark McGowan had little choice but to release his transition plan and the health modelling to go with it.", "The plan, he said, was to open the border when 90 per cent of the state's population aged 12 and above was fully vaccinated against COVID-19.", "", "
WA Premier Mark McGowan announces the government's plan to reopen the state's borders.
", "Easing border restrictions with\u00a080 per cent of the state's population vaccinated\u00a0would result in more than twice the number of cases in a year, according to the WA Health modelling.", "The 90 per cent vaccination target might be reached in late January or early February, based on the current trajectory.", "But after much anticipation, it came as a bit of a disappointment for those who were trying to plan their lives and livelihoods around the reopening.", "", "
Contact registers and the SafeWA app will still be in place at all public venues.\u00a0(ABC News: Keane Bourke)
", "Travel agent Christian Hunter said it was great to have a plan to work towards, but it was missing a crucial element.\u00a0", "\"It is a bit of a blow to our sector that we don't have clarity around a date,\" Mr Hunter said.", "
Threat of restrictions lingers
", "Mr McGowan said the reopening date would be announced\u00a0next month, once 80 per cent of the eligible population had been vaccinated.\u00a0", "He said once that date was announced, it would be set in stone.\u00a0", "However he also issued a warning that\u00a0if WA does\u00a0not reach that target by the set date, further public health and social measures would need to be put in place.", "\"Restrictions on venues, restrictions on workplaces, restrictions when it comes to masks \u2014\u00a0all those sorts of things that we're desperately trying to avoid,\" he said.", "That was something the hospitality industry, in particular, wanted to avoid at all costs.", "Stuart Laws, from the Chefs Collective, said he loves\u00a0the 90 per cent vaccination target.\u00a0", "\"Having that 90 per cent just gives us a little bit of confidence that, when we do open the borders, we're not going to be in the position where we were in the beginning of 2020, when we were all running for the hills going 'where's my next pay cheque\u00a0coming from?',\" he said.", "
Health funding in the nick of time
", "The biggest question had always been how the state's already overstretched hospital system would be able to cope.", "", "
Mr McGowan said waiting for the vaccination rate to hit 90 per cent would place less pressure on WA hospitals, which are already under strain.\u00a0(ABC News: Keane Bourke)
", "On Wednesday, Mr McGowan announced a plan aimed at addressing those concerns \u2014\u00a0$400 million for 270 additional hospital beds and hundreds more staff.", "The funding was welcomed by the Australian Medical Association, which had been calling for this kind of commitment for many months.", "Those 270 extra beds should be opened by August next year, before peak hospitalisations hit, according to WA's Chief Health Officer Andy Robertson.\u00a0", "\"We will be pushing the curve out well beyond our normal winter and we will also be flattening that curve so that we won't have the cases,\" Dr Robertson said.", "\"With the beds announced earlier in the week, the intention is that we will be able to do the business as usual.\u00a0", "The Premier is hoping this plan will allow for a smooth landing into life with COVID-19 that will\u00a0see minimal infections, hospitalisations and deaths, while life continues as closely to normal\u00a0as possible in the west \u2014\u00a0at the same time as friends and families are being reunited."]
